SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.redis.codec

Class RESPValue

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.redis.codec.RESPValue
public final class RESPValue extends Object
Represents a decoded RESP value.

A RESP value can be one of several types: simple string, error, integer, bulk string, or array. This class provides type-safe access to the value based on its type.

Bulk strings and arrays can also be null, represented by the special null instance returned by nullValue().

Author:
Chris Burdess

    • asString

      public String asString()
      Returns this value as a string.

      For simple strings and errors, returns the string directly. For bulk strings, decodes as UTF-8. For integers, returns the string representation. For arrays and null, returns null.

      Returns:
      the string value, or null

    • asLong

      public long asLong()
      Returns this value as a long integer.
      Returns:
      the integer value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this is not an integer type

    • asBytes

      public byte[] asBytes()
      Returns this value as a byte array.

      For bulk strings, returns the raw bytes. For simple strings and errors, encodes as UTF-8.

      Returns:
      the byte array, or null if null or array type

    • asArray

      public List<RESPValue> asArray()
      Returns this value as an array of RESP values.

      the array elements, or null if not an array

      Returns:
      the error message, or null if not an error

    • getErrorType

      public String getErrorType()
      Returns the error type if this is an error value.

      Redis errors typically have a prefix like "ERR", "WRONGTYPE", "MOVED", etc.

      Returns:
      the error type prefix, or null if not an error
